text: Peter Humphrey says it was a show trial
for the cameras and that he and his wife
unions are work collateral damage
they've become embroiled in a bigger
drama a corruption investigation at GSK
the British pharmaceuticals giant had
bribed Chinese doctors to buy its
medicines but the boss who was convicted
did not go to prison now back home in
Surrey I asked Peter Humphrey why he had
his wife did I think it's very simple
the answer is we don't have and we
didn't have half a billion dollars to
pay the authorities that story was about
money from the beginning money got them
into trouble and when he got him out
initially the British consul that were
more communicative than the Americans a
year ago Peters teenage son Harvey
showed me desperate prison letters from
his parents
corporate investigators convicted of
selling the personal data of Chinese
citizens to their multinational clients
a miscarriage of justice he says which
some could have helped overturn they
were probably one or two clients with
enough influence to have done something
you kept quiet why would they keep quiet
I guess they would be afraid of ruffling
feathers or or making the noise that
might put their own business in jeopardy
I'm not gonna name any but do you think
the clients in question do you think any
of them had a responsibility to help yes
I do it might be different in a
different environment that in the
Chinese environment people are very
nervous about sticking their neck out on
somebody else's behalf that's
disappointing
I guess it's life in China this story
goes back to a series of anonymous
allegations against GSK with decades of
China experience Peter Humphrey was
hired to investigate the source of these
and a secretly filmed sex video of GSA's
top boss in China even now he's
reluctant to discuss any of this I'm not
prepared to identify it by name any of
the individuals who I was angry with at
this time it's not impossible that we
may sue some of those parties or through
other means try to seek redress he has a
warning for those who see China as the
next big business opportunity there are
some wider lessons one of them is for
governments including the British
government who need to understand that
when they encourage their companies to
go and do business in China these
companies faces serious risks and I
think they need to understand that
absolutely any company and any
individual going to China could be the
next party to suffer our fate if they
fail to understand this and manage this
risk so how did he get through the
ordeal of a crowded and squalid jail
cell separated from his wife and without
desperately needed medical treatment my
wife and I were able to exchange letters
through a very laborious procedure
from time to time and these these
letters showed me the strength of our
love for each other so I think what
sustains me above all wealth maybe was
this knowledge of how strong our love
was for each other this kept us both
nourished in the following months but
once the investigator always the
investigator from a world away in rural
England Peter Humphrey is determined to
work out exactly what triggered his
two-year nightmare in Shanghai Carrie
Gracie BBC News
